javadoc:
Class that represents a file of property names and values. The file
 extension used is PROPERTY_EXT.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a new or existing PropertyFile.
 This form ignores retained property values for NAME and PARENT path.

methods.javadoc:
Return the name of this PropertyFile.  A null value may be returned
 if this is an older property file and the name was not specified at
 time of construction.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment:
Return the name of this PropertyFile.  A null value may be returned
 if this is an older property file and the name was not specified at
 time of construction.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if file is writable
methods.name: isReadOnly
methods.comment: Returns true if file is writable

methods.javadoc:
Return the path to this PropertyFile.  A null value may be returned
 if this is an older property file and the name and parentPath was not specified at
 time of construction.
methods.name: getPath
methods.comment:
Return the path to this PropertyFile.  A null value may be returned
 if this is an older property file and the name and parentPath was not specified at
 time of construction.

methods.javadoc: Return the path to the parent of this PropertyFile.
methods.name: getParentPath
methods.comment: Return the path to the parent of this PropertyFile.

methods.javadoc: Return the parent file to this PropertyFile.
methods.name: getFolder
methods.comment: Return the parent file to this PropertyFile.

methods.javadoc:
Return the storage name of this PropertyFile.  This name does not include the property
 file extension (.prp)
methods.name: getStorageName
methods.comment:
Return the storage name of this PropertyFile.  This name does not include the property
 file extension (.prp)

methods.javadoc:
Returns the FileID associated with this file.
@returns FileID associated with this file
methods.name: getFileID
methods.comment: Returns the FileID associated with this file.

methods.javadoc:
Set the FileID associated with this file.
@param fileId
methods.name: setFileID
methods.comment: Set the FileID associated with this file.

methods.name: getInt
methods.comment: Return the int value with the given propertyName.

params.name: propertyName
params.comment: name of property that is an int

params.name: defaultValue
params.comment: value to use if the property does not exist

methods.name: putInt
methods.comment: Assign the int value to the given propertyName.

methods.name: getLong
methods.comment: Return the long value with the given propertyName.

params.name: propertyName
params.comment: name of property that is a long

params.name: defaultValue
params.comment: value to use if the property does not exist

methods.name: putLong
methods.comment: Assign the long value to the given propertyName.

methods.name: getString
methods.comment: Return the string value with the given propertyName.

params.name: propertyName
params.comment: name of property that is a string

params.name: defaultValue
params.comment: value to use if the property does not exist

methods.name: putString
methods.comment: Assign the string value to the given propertyName.

methods.name: getBoolean
methods.comment: Return the boolean value with the given propertyName.

params.name: propertyName
params.comment: name of property that is a boolean

params.name: defaultValue
params.comment: value to use if the property does not exist

methods.name: putBoolean
methods.comment: Assign the boolean value to the given propertyName.

methods.javadoc:
Remove the specified property
@param propertyName
methods.name: remove
methods.comment: Remove the specified property

methods.javadoc: Return the time of last modification in number of milliseconds.
methods.name: lastModified
methods.comment: Return the time of last modification in number of milliseconds.

methods.javadoc:
Write the contents of this PropertyFile.
@throws IOException thrown if there was a problem writing the file
methods.name: writeState
methods.comment: Write the contents of this PropertyFile.

throws.comment: thrown if there was a problem writing the file

methods.javadoc:
Read in this PropertyFile into a SaveState object.
@throws IOException thrown if there was a problem reading the file
methods.name: readState
methods.comment: Read in this PropertyFile into a SaveState object.

throws.comment: thrown if there was a problem reading the file

methods.name: moveTo
methods.comment: Move this PropertyFile to the newParent file.

params.name: newParentPath
params.comment: parent path of the new parent

throws.comment:
thrown if a file with the newName
 already exists
thrown if there was a problem accessing the

methods.javadoc: Return whether the file for this PropertyFile exists.
methods.name: exists
methods.comment: Return whether the file for this PropertyFile exists.

methods.javadoc: Delete the file for this PropertyFile.
methods.name: delete
methods.comment: Delete the file for this PropertyFile.

name: PropertyFile
comment:
Class that represents a file of property names and values. The file
 extension used is PROPERTY_EXT.

fields.javadoc: File extension indicating the file is a property file.
fields.name: PROPERTY_EXT
fields.comment: File extension indicating the file is a property file.
